Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass vs Best Medical Treatment in Patients with Type 2 Diabetes and Early-Stage CKD

Trial_Design.evidence: This single-center, randomised controlled trial was conducted from April 1, 2013, to March 31, 2016, involving 100 patients

Participants.evidence: involving 100 patients with type 2 diabetes, obesity (BMI 30-35), and stage G1 to G3 and A2 to A3 CKD

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to receive Roux-en-Y gastric bypass (RYGB) or best medical treatment

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was remission of albuminuria (uACR <30 mg/g) at 24 months

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applied to patients or clinicians

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 51 patients were randomised to RYGB and 49 to best medical treatment

Result_Outcome.evidence: 82% (95% CI, 72%-93%) of RYGB patients compared to 55% (95% CI, 39%-70%) in the control group (P = .006)

Harms.evidence: No significant difference in the rate of serious adverse events was observed between groups

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under ClinicalTrials.gov Identifier NCT01821508
